resources.string: Pick a server for APK downloads.
Enable this if patched apps do not work after some time.
Enable this if you are unable to remove other fb apps.
Remove temporary files from the cache.
Wondering whether it is safe to use?
Visit the help forum and ask your question.
Visit the github repository of the project.
WARNING: Fallback mode is currently enabled. If you didn\'t intend to enable it, please disable it from the settings tab.

Instructions: 

Uninstall all official facebook apps: facebook, messenger, facebook lite, etc. 

Install the ChatHeadEnabler module. 

Patch and install Messenger apps from here. 

Please watch the video tutorial (from the app menu) for complete instructions. 

[Visit the help forum from the settings tab]

Troubleshoot: 

Download failed? 
Select different servers or try again later. 
Alternatively, you can download Messenger from apkmirror.com and patch it using the manual option. 

Install failed? 
Ensure you have uninstalled all fb apps. If some fb apps cannot be uninstalled, enable the "Fix Apk-Conflict" option and try patching again. 

Not working? 
Ensure you have installed ChatHeadEnabler. Also, try restarting the Messenger app. 

Not working after a few days? 
Enable fallback mode and then patch again. 

[Visit the help forum from the settings tab]

Safety Note: 

Is it safe to use? 
Yes. It is safe, just like any other app installed from the playstore. 
[Make sure you installed the MRVPatch Manager from the official github link] 

How can I be sure it is safe? 
All the apps used here are open source, and you can find their source codes on github. 

What safety measures are taken? 
The manager downloads your selected app from the apk servers and verifies it against the original facebook signature, ensuring that you are patching an official Facebook app.
